1152221121.content:
Konohamaru watched Naruto as he said his goodbyes and left Tsunade’s office. As soon as the door latched shut, Konohamaru gulped. Something was going to happen, and he didn’t think he was going to like it.

“Well, well, well,” Tsunade began, staring down at the miniature man in her hand. “Looks like you’ve been put under a curse, little guy.” Konohamaru stared up at her enormous face, her full lips curled into a mischievous smile.

“A curse?” he asked nervously. As he spoke, he realized just how silly he sounded. Whereas his voice was rather high pitched before this whole event, he now sounded absolutely pathetic, even to himself. “What do you mean by a curse? Is it some form of technique? How do you get rid of it? How do I get back to normal?”

Tsunade smiled down at the anxious boy. “A curse,” she explained, “is a form of technique. But, it’s a rare form of technique. You see, most curses have either time limits, or certain requirements for them to wear off. In this case, it seems as though there’s a time limit involved.”

Konohamaru gulped hard, frightened by the idea of a time limit. “How long do I have to wait?”

“Oh, that depends.” Tsunade walked over to the chair behind her desk and sat down, placing Konohamaru on the cluttered desk in front of her. Konohamaru stood on the desk, looking over the piles of paper and jars full of pencils. “It could take minutes, hours, days, weeks, months…” A flood of anxiety poured over Konohamaru as he looked up at the giant woman, her blonde pigtails looking intimidating for the first time since he’d seen them. She continued, taking some sick pleasure in watching the boy squirm. “Or, I could be wrong, and the curse may be permanent.”

“No, no, that can’t be it!” he yelled up at her, pleading. “Even if it is permanent, you can still find some way to fix it, right? You’re the greatest medical shinobi in the world, right? You’ve gotta be able to do something!”

Tsunade’s grin widen as she watched the young child plead. “I don’t know. You’ve put me through an awful lot since I first arrived here. If I were to help you now, what good would that do me? Having you normal again would just allow you to do more harm. At an inch high, I’d be surprised if you could do much at all, let alone annoy me.” She placed her elbows down upon the desk, her head in her hands. By doing this, she was giving Konohamaru a great look into her cleavage, and he did indeed look. In fact, he looked for far too long. Tsunade noticed his wandering eyes and leaned back in her chair, folding her arms over her chest. “And you’re a pervert as well!”

Konohamaru stammered incoherently, trying to find the words to say. Nothing he could think of seemed like it would work. If he told her that he wasn’t a pervert, she’d tell him that he was a liar as well. And if he accepted the fact that he was perverted, then she definitely wouldn’t help him. After a minute or so of this internal struggle, Konohamaru finally managed to say, “I’m sorry.”

“Now,” Tsunade began, looking intently at Konohamaru, “I think I know what this curse is, but if you want me to help you undo what’s been done, you’re going to have to earn it.”

He was silent for a moment, but then asked, “What is it that you want me to do?”

“First of all, we’ll establish a system that will benefit both of us. You want to return to your normal height, and I want some respect and appreciation. Since you are the one with the most to gain here, it only makes sense that you’ll be the one who works the hardest. And if you even think about breaking our system, the punishment will be severe.” To illustrate her point, she slammed her hand down upon the table, shaking the loose contents, and knocking Konohamaru off of his feet. “Do you understand?”

“Y-yes, Tsunade-sama,” Konohamaru says weakly, very much intimidated by the giant woman before him. “I understand c-completely.”

Tsunade shakes her head, disappointed by his response. “No, no, no, that wasn’t any good at all. I want you to try it again, and this time put some effort into it. And you’re not to call me Tsunade-sama! That’s far too formal for our little system.” She stresses the word ‘little,’ simply to push the tiny boy’s buttons. “Until our system is finished I want you to refer to me as your Queen. And until our system is finished, that is what I shall be.” Tsunade once again slammed her hand upon the table with a great “thud.”

“Yes, my Queen! I understand, and I’ll do whatever it is you want!” Konohamaru yelled forcefully, straining his voice to do so. The fifth hokage smiled victoriously.

“Alright, then, you’ve earned yourself a little treat.” Tsunade motioned for Konohamaru to approach her. He hesitated, but obliged. She placed her hands upon the desk, one on each side of Konohamaru’s body, and began to speak an incantation. Konohamaru closed his eyes tight, fearing what would come next. There was a loud “poof,” and Konohamaru slowly opened his eyes. When he did, he found that the world, at least to him, had changed. Tsunade’s hands, while still huge to him, weren’t as big as before. He smiled joyfully for a second, then he stared up at his ‘Queen.’ This gratitude wasn’t free, he reminded himself.

“Alright, then, you’re now just over nine inches tall,” she tells him, running her hand through her hair, and smiling. “Do you know why I chose this height?” Konohamaru shook his head. “Well, then I guess it’s time for me to explain your first assignment.” She pulled herself back in the chair, its wheels making a sharp, metallic sound. Then, without warning, she flips her legs up into the air, and her feet land hard on the desk, knocking the poor boy off of his legs once more. “You, my little guy, are now the same height as these two lovely beauties.” Wiggling her feet, she watched him get to his feet and try to maintain his balance. “And you’re first job is to give them a massage.”

Konohamaru approached her gigantic feet, clad in jet black high heels. His first action was going to be removing the heels, which was not going to be easy. Grabbing the first clasp and releasing it, Konohamaru started his first assignment. Despite his reservations, the young boy was eager to get his life back to normal, no matter what it took. So he unclasped the three straps of her left heel, then prepared himself to pull the heel away from her foot. It was much heavier than he had imagined, but he finally managed to pull the heel away from Tsunade’s left foot, and far enough away from them that it wouldn’t get in the way. She then wiggled her right foot, and Konohamaru repeated the same process with the right heel. When both heels were removed, Tsunade positioned her feet into a vertical position.

As he approached the two walls of flesh, he had no choice but to stare in awe. She hadn’t been lying when she said that he was now the same size as her feet. In fact, the very tip of her big toe seemed to extend just as high up as the tip of his own head.

Pushing these thoughts aside, the boy went to work, beginning with the arch of her left foot. As he worked the soft flesh, he could hear Tsunade moan lightly with delight. He continued, working his way up and down the entirety of the delicate skin. Some time passed by, and Konohamaru could feel his muscles begin to burn. For a brief second he stopped, but as soon as he did so, Tsunade raised her legs into the air, and once again dropped them down onto the desk.

“I’m sorry, my Queen!” he yelled, then hurried to return to his duties.

A whole half of an hour passed, and Konohamaru had just finished his task. He collapsed onto his knees, and heard his Queen say, “Very good, despite your little mistake. Maybe I should keep you this size forever. It’s always troublesome to find someone willing to massage your feet.” The boy looked up in fright at her words. She laughed heartily, then said, “I’m only kidding. I’ll keep my bargain.” Once again, she motioned for Konohamaru to approach. This time he did not hesitate at all. She placed her hands down upon the desk and recited the incantation again. The familiar “poof” rang out, and Konohamaru found that the world had once again changed for him. He wasn’t back to normal, but he was big enough to complete his next task. But what was it going to be?

11522222222222221211.content:
"Hmm...hold on tight, little ones. And...try not to mind the smell," the smirking giantess booms to the puny boys, who, in their fear of her godly size, quickly climb her sandal and, after a few seconds of running up the monolithic leather shoe, reach the top. The three ninja are then met with the powerful scent of feet, which at their size is overwhelming and hits like a wave. Kiba especially, thanks to his naturally powerful sense of smell, is affected, his eyes tearing up as he holds his nose with both hands. Even the calm Shino was having difficulty grasping their situation and trying not to faint.
"Ugh! Dammit, Shizune! Do you ever wash these???" Naruto shouts up to the titaness, who is enjoying watching the inferior creatures try and adjust to her feet.
"Heh you just don't appreciate beauty when you see it, little man. Now quit your complaining and get between my toes so you won't fall off when I'm walking," she replies, spreading her sweaty toes with a wink, "c'mon, boys. Pick your favorite and maybe I won't squeeze too tight."
"Ugh! As if! The smell itself will kill us before you will!" Naruto roars, turning his back to the towering toes and crossing his arms.
"Uh, Naruto...maybe we better do as she says," Kiba suggests, still holding his nose.
"Hmph! What are you, a wimp?" Naruto replies. As he does this, Shizune's smug expression changes to that of frustration and she puts her hands on her hips as she glares down at her disobedient bug-man.
"Naruto..." Shino warns as he sees Shizune's change in stance, which prompts Kiba to look up and see it also and freeze with fear.
"Heh I beat Kabuto back when I was still a kid, AFTER he beat Shizune! I think I can handle her no matter what size sh-" His thoughts are cut off as he feels something getting close to him and he turns in time to be pinned by a MASSIVE big toe, shoving him down onto his back onto Shizune's insole. Her sweat quickly began washing over his tiny body, and the smell grew stronger and stronger as she slowly presses down on his tiny body.
"Say you're sorry," her mighty voice thunders overhead as she increases the pressure on his miniscule form.
"I-I'm...sorry, Shizune! Please don't crush me!" Naruto squeaks, struggling against the strong toe to no avail. His arrogance quickly fades as he realizes that her mere toe muscles EASILY outclass all the muscles in his entire body combined in strength.
"Sigh...idiot," Kiba exclaims, face-palming.
"Good...now call me "mistress"," Shizune adds with slight chuckle.
"You can't be serious!" Naruto bellows, whipping out a kunai and stabbing her toe-flesh. The blade squishes into her flesh and shatters without doing any damage, not even a scratch. Furious, Shizune stomps her foot, causing a massive earthquake to the tiny shinobi.
"You WILL call me mistress and kiss my toe for your insolence!" the godlike kunoichi roars, the sound waves from her speech alone causing Kiba and Shino to fall down on their butts.
"Y-yes mistress!" Naruto shrieks in fear as he gives her toe a small peck.
"Much better...now get. Between. My toes!" she finishes, crossing her arms. The tiny boys quickly did as she was told, entering the sweaty prisons for their journey to who knows where.
With a slight squeeze to make sure they were all secure between her digits, Shizune regains her composure and says, "Now hold on tight, little ones; this might be a bumpy ride." She then begins walking out towards the Hokage building...

115222222222222212111.content:
(Since this route is supposed to be Naruto, Shikamaru, and Shino. That's who I'm using.)

Naruto couldn't believe this. The day had started out so well too. First he was told by grandma Tsunade that he'd officially be getting an S-rank mission. Next he found out he was going to be completing this mission with his friends. Then everything had gone wrong from there.

Once they left the office they'd all somehow shrunk to 1cm in height. Lastly big sis Shizune showed up which lead them all to right now, sandwiched between her massive sweaty digits. Every step she took was like a long elevator ride. First all three were launched high in the air at incredible speeds and thrusted back down.

Honestly if they weren't wedged between her toes they'd either fly off her sandal or slide under her sole and get flattened. While Shikamaru and Shino did a fairly good job of keeping their emotions in check, Naruto was a lot more... Expressive.

"What the hell! I can't believe this! Watch your damn step Shizune!" Naruto shouted. If she heard him she didn't show it.

"What are you doing you idiot? Haven't you done enough?" Shikamaru admonished.

"Do you really plan on envoking her wrath again?" Shino asked.

Naruto thought back to his failed attempt at an attack but refused to let his embarrassment show. "I don't care! We need to get out of here and finish our mission!"

"Finish it? We haven't even started it." Shino stated.

"Plus there is the large likelihood that lady Shizune is taking us straight to lady Tsunade. Remember she said she knew our mission." Shikamaru reminded.

"Maybe?" Naruto huffed.

"Besides. Right now I'm more interested in how we got so small in the first place." Shikamaru wondered. "This can't be a prank. So was this the work of an enemy? If so how'd they do it and can they do it again?"

There was a slong silence before it was broken by another footfall. This time it had caused a large clump of sweat to hit Naruto dead in the face. Angry didn't even begin to describe how he felt. "I said watch your damn step Shizune! While you're at it wash your damn feet every once in a while! Hmph! Women."

"Shut it you idiot!" Shikamaru warned.

"But she..."

"Enough!" Shino growled. His patience with the blonde was thinning. The last thing he wanted was Shizune's rage to fall upon him in case she heard them.

Little did they know thanks to her chakra enhanced hearing. She heard every word.

Eventually she reached her destination which was her mentor's office. She opened the doors to find Lady Tsunade alone at her desk filing papers and enjoying her Sake. While staying stationary the tinies down below got another good whiff of Shizune's foot stink and stung their eyes.

Naruto was cursing up a storm.

"Oh, Shizune?" Tsunade greeted. "What are you doing here?"
115222222222222212111.title: Heel Ride

1152222222222222121113.content:
Shizune bowed to her Hokage.

"Team Shizune reporting my lady. The jutsu appears to have delayed effect on the three of them but all in all it was a success."

Shizune knelt down and plucked the tinies out from between her toes, much to Narutos dismay.

"Hey! Shizune what do you think your doing handling me like this!"

Shizune gave no response as she deposited them on Tsunades desk.

"Granny Tsunade? What the hell is going on? I thought we had an S-rank mission to finish but now were the size of rice grains!", Naruto yelled.

"If you'll allow me to explain Naruto. The mission is still S-rank, but theres more to it than simply retrieving a scroll. The three of you will accompany Shizune to the Hidden Steam village where you are to meet with agents sent by a notorious business mogul. These agents claim that they are going to trade this scroll to us in exchange for information on the whereabouts of a rogue agent of theirs. But reports claim that the agents hired an organization of mercenary shinobi to cross us at the meeting and take our information by force."

"Understood Lady Hokage... by why lie to us about the true nature of our mission in the first place?", asked Shikamaru.

"And more importantly... Why are we so small!!!", Naruto interrupted.

Tsunade sighed in annoyance at Narutos outburst.

"We had reason to believe that the initial mission brief was being monitored by one of the mercenary's spies, thats why I gave you a false mission. In regards to your size, not only will keeping a low profile be much easier now, but so will communication and espionage of our own. The enemy is outfitted with sensory type shinobi and radio jammers to keep whoever we sent in the dark. Thats why you are to stick close to Shizune and report whatever you notice to her."

Shizune smiled down at the trio on the desk.

"I would think you of all people would be quite excited about this Naruto. After all if a fight was to break out you would definitely have the challenge you've been looking for."

Naruto giggled and scratched the back of his head.

"Yeah I guess your right. Fighting giant ninja would be a fight to remember for sure. Just dont think your going to be carrying me around like Im some kind of pet alright!"

"Ha. Speak for yourself.", Shikamaru said. "Seems to me that Shizune will be doing all the walking while we get to relax in her pocket."

Shizune sighed and Tsunade began to speak.

"You have your mission. If all goes well this should be nothing more than a simple exchange, even though it is highly unlikely it will be that easy. However, that does not mean you should go looking to cause trouble.", said Tsunade, obviously targeting the last part at Naruto. "If things were to escalate, that would ultimately lead to this particular business mogul having to be dealt with, which would be quite troublesome to say the least."

"Dont worry Lady Tsunade. Everything will be under control.", said Shizune.

Tsunade nodded.

"Good. I leave this to you then. Good luck. Come back safe."

Shizune nodded, and placed her hand on the table. Shino and Shikamaru walked onto her palm but Naruto hesitated.

"I dont think so! What did I say about being held?"

"Naruto just get on.", Shizune pleaded, already exhausted by his constant stubbornness.

Naruto jumped onto Shizunes sleeve and ran up her arm to her shoulder. Shizune sighed once again as she bowed and took her leave, rolling her eyes when she heard Tsunade snicker at the boys antics.

"Like I said! I'm Naruto Uzumaki! Not some kind of house pet to be held and snuggled with! I'll stay up here thank you very much."

"Whatever you say Naruto. Just as long as you know to hide yourself once we reach the Hidden Steam."

"Of course I will."

Shizune smirked. She then opened her kimono and placed Shino and Shikamaru inside her breast pocket and closed it again.

11522222222222221211131.content:
"Are there yet?"

"Naruto, that's the fifth time you've asked me that in the last five minutes." Shizune sighed. This was going to be a long trip, especially since she'd be making it on foot. It was far too risky to take any form of public transportation at the moment. It was much safer to stick to the woods and dirt path's at the moment.

"Sorry, but I'm just psyched!" Naruto cheered from his perch on Shizune's shoulder. "This'll be my first S-rank mission, ya know! And from up here it looks like the world's just passin' me by."

The giantess couldn't help but smile at Naruto's enthusiasm despite the circumstances and his constant pestering. The pestering she could do without, but his upright attitude could be really infectious sometimes. "Well don't go getting all distracted on me now. You still need to keep your senses sharp as the enemy could be anywhere at any time."

"No sweat. If the enemy show their faces, I'll clobber em'!" Naruto brushed off. Shizune again sighed. As positive as the whiskered blonde was, a little concern would be much appreciated. The world wasn't a fairy-tail. This was the real world and anything could go wrong at any time.

Oh well. At least she could tell no one currently had eyes on them as she continued her trek down the dirt path. They were all still three days out from the land of steam. She had the entire trip planned out in her mind. A whole lot of walking and maybe a boat ride along the way.

Naruto continued to yammer on as her thoughts turned towards the tiny Shikamaru and Shino that were most likely lounging in her kimono's inner breast pocket. Even small there natural skills shouldn't be impaired all that much. Shino's insect control should still be on point and Shikamaru's brain should still be as reliable as ever. Still, a part of her wondered what the two were doing right now.

"Shizune?! Hey Shizune?!" Naruto called, breaking her out of her thoughts.

"Yes? What is it?" She asked.

"Jeez. I was trying to ask how long this trips going to take." Naruto groaned. He was excited sure, but patience wasn't necessarily his strong suit.

The giantess resisted the urge to facepalm. "For the umpteenth time, I told you this trip will take roughly three days. I'll be doing all the walking so you having nothing to complain about."

"But I'm so bored." Naruto slouched.

He was really starting to get on her nerves.

Oblivious to his transportation's growing annoyance, he decided to amuse himself the best way he knew how. "Are we there yet?"

Shizune felt her eye twitch. "Naruto..."

"I'm just messing with you!" Naruto grinned. "You just have the best reactions.

Tickmark.

"Naruto. If you keep being annoying, you're going back between my toes..." Shizune warned.

The shrunken shinobi pouted...

115222222222222222113.content:
Naruto found himself knocked down on the floor, wrapped within his Sage cloak. Once he freed himself from it and stood up, he saw that he was in some kind of room, with wooden floor and some furniture. There was something wrong, though, because when Naruto started walking around, he realized that everything looked much bigger than usual: The furniture, the wooden boards on the floor and even the door. When he reached the bed, he discovered in amazement that it was as big as a small city and the columns at the base were as high as a building. There was no doubt, he had been transported to a giant room... or even worse, someone had shrunk him!

Naruto tried to ponder how and why he had ended up like that, the last thing he remembered was an encounter with a pair members of Akatsuki, the evil ninja organization. He was fighting a them when suddenly he felt an unknown force envelop him from head to toe and he started getting weakened, the last thing he saw before he lost consciousness was a stranger appearing out of nowhere between the other two ninjas.

The Uzumaki boy was thinking about how to get out of that room when suddenly the sound of footsteps approaching came to his ears, the planks of the floor began to rattle at each of the giant's footfalls and were so strong that Naruto started to worry. How big does this guy have to be to shake the floor? Will he be able to help me out of this mess or will he be one of my enemies? I'd better hide so I can see him. The fox boy thought as he sought shelter, under the bed he found a cardboard tube big enough to hide in, so he went inside and poked his head out so he could see the stranger. Moments later the door opened and the well-known shape of a bluish man appeared. Upon recognizing him, Naruto was terrified. The giant guy was no other than Kisame, the infamous Shark Ninja.

Kisame closed the door and removed his black cloak, revealing his muscular chest. He just kept his blue pants, beige anklets and purple sandals on. Then he started walking around the room inspecting every corner, as if he were looking for something. As he walked, the shark boy's massive feet triggered the planks of the floor to rattle again and, worried by this, Naruto reduced his chakra trail to avoid being detected. Kisame rampaged through the room for several minutes, after which he didn’t seem to find what he was looking for.
115222222222222222113.title: Naruto shrunken down at Kisame's mercy

choices: Kisame seems to spot Naruto in the tube and decides to play with it.
Kisame sneezes, but is still distracted and Naruto takes the chance to escape.
1152222222222222221132.content:
However, instead of leaving as Naruto was hoping, the shark boy decided to rest on the bed and his feet headed towards the spot where the fox boy's hideout was.

As Kisame’s huge sandals stomped dangerously toward him, Naruto had to hold onto the walls of the tube to keep from falling, as it began to roll due to the shaking of the floor. After a few seconds the shark boy took a seat on the bed and dropped both feet on the floor, which caused the fox boy’s hideout to stop moving. Naruto waited for a while and since he didn't hear any loud noise above him, he thought that the giant ninja had fallen asleep and decided to take the opportunity to escape from the room. However, when he was about to come out of the tube, Kisame’s right sandal fell right in front of him and blocked his way out. The fox boy rushed to the other side but before he could get there, a second giant purple sandal cut him off.

Naruto couldn't believe it, he was trapped inside a small cardboard tube, cornered between nothing less than the shark boy's big feet, which were so sweaty that their stench began to build up within the cramped space of the tube. With just a glance at the huge sandals that wiggled slightly around on the floor, the Uzumaki boy knew that their owner must be at least 15 times his own size. Damn it! I can't let this monster catch me. I'll cut a hole in the wall so I can escape from him. Naruto thought and after taking out a kunai from his ninja pouch, he started making his way through the curved wall of the tube. This wasn't easy at all; the cardboard wall was too hard to cut with his kunai and he had to scratch it several times just to make a crack.

Naruto had barely managed to make a small hole in the tube when suddenly he heard loud noises around him, he immediately stopped cutting and as he turned to the sides he discovered that Kisame's feet were gone. Full of curiosity the fox boy peeked through the hole he had made and as he looked up he recognized the shark boy's face in the distance, he had put his feet up on the bed and was cutting his rough toenails his gaze showed boredom. The Uzumaki boy began to ponder, this could be his chance to escape, his enemy was distracted enough to not notice him if he got under the bed and snuck out that way. But also the shark boy was looking down, so Nato had to be careful enough that his enemy didn't see him getting out of the tube. While thinking about it, Kisame...
1152222222222222221132.title: Trapped in the hideout

choices: Under the rubbery bottom of Kisame's left sandal.
Between the insole and Kisame's right foot toes.
11522222222222222211321.content:
Kisame looked around the floor, it seemed that he had noticed something strange and unfortunately for Naruto it was so, as his gaze focused on the small cardboard tube at his feet and as it did so his sharp teeth turned into a wicked grin.

The next thing the Uzumaki boy saw was the well-known pair of purple, rugged outsoles coming down dangerously towards him. Kisame dropped his huge sandals onto the cardboard tube and after making sure that their rubbery bottoms had settled down around its curved surface, the giant ninja used both feet to drag the tube back and forth across the floor. Naruto had to hold on tight to the walls so that he wouldn't fall, because he was afraid that if he got out of his hideout at that moment, the shark boy would recognize him immediately and catch him. However, the cardboard tube was being battered beneath the oversized feet of Kisame, who seemed to know that the fox boy was hiding inside and therefore took advantage of the thick, rough bottoms on his two sandals to force him out.

After a while of rolling the tube, the shark boy kicked it so hard that it was thrown to one end of the room, where it bounced off the wall and rolled back to Kisame, who trapped it between his sandals and began to kick it around, making sure it stayed within reach of his feet. Naruto began to feel dizzy from the strong shaking that his shelter was being subjected to,each thump that he received from the hefty sandals was as strong as a train impact, but he managed to hold on tight and avoid being thrown out. However, when Kisa got tired of playing football he dropped both feet onto the tube and started pressing them down and up, increasing his weight with each stomp that his sandals gave.

Naruto couldn’t believe what was happening, he had become Kisame’s foot-toy without being sure if he had discovered him or not, the walls of the tube began to crease beneath the pressure of the Shark Boy's mammoth sandals,threatening the fox boy with being trapped there and being crushed, he had to think quickly what to do or else he would end up being caught. Suddenly Kisame changed his mind and dropped his feet on the sides of the tube again, Naruto’s little body shuddered hard and after standing up again he discovered that the hole he had made was now on the floor.

Looking around, Naruto realized he only had two ways to escape: Through the left side of the tube, where he would have to crawl beneath the rubber outsole of Kisame's sandal; or through the right side, making his way between the insole of Shark Boy's second sandal and his thick toes, which were slightly detached from it and there was enough room for him to get through.

Which way will Naruto try to escape?

"That's my room," he said form were she had put him. Nodding, she opened the door and flipped on the light. Immediately, her eyes were met with the sight of dozens of scrolls, books, and wadded up pieces of paper on his bed and on the ground. A few ramen cups sat on the floor, and it was painfully obvious that he hadn't done any cleaning in at least a week.

She smirked at him. "I didn't know you studied," she teased, causing him to scratch the back of his head sheepishly.

"Yeah, well, I was just reading up on seals and stuff. Ero-sennin said if I learned the basics, he'd teach me how to do the cool stuff later. It's kinda hard, though." The blond girl glanced back at the scrolls and frowned.

'Seals, huh?' she thought, scratching her head slightly. She'd learned how to seal small things like weapons and clothing from her dad, but anything larger than a meter was out of the question. “Oy, oy! Hey, Shikamaru!” Naruto hollered as they approached. Ino’s brow twitched slightly, and she slowly turned to face the group. As soon as she did so, her mouth curled up into a forced smile. Of course, she was delighted to see Sasuke, but… Well, let’s say she could do without Sakura… Forever.

Shikamaru nodded toward Naruto, saying, “Hey, I got your message. You wanted to see me about something?”

“Yeah, it’s about that new technique I’ve been reading about,” Naruto answered as he and Shikamaru wandered off. As soon as they were gone, Chouji and Sasuke gave each other an anxious glance.

“I think we should leave these two alone for a while,” Sasuke whispered, watching as Sakura and Ino glared at one another. Chouji nodded, shoving a handful of chips into his mouth. “What do you say we head over to Irunai’s Diner?”

As the two hurried off, the girls continued to stare angrily at one another, the tension between them so palpable it could be cut with a spoon. Sakura was the first to break the horrible stare, saying, “Sasuke and I are going to do some training later today. It’s important that I don’t waste energy with someone as insignificant as you.” She shut her eyes, crossed her arms over her chest, and let out a “humph.”

Ino felt a surge of anger swell up inside her, ready to burst out, but she forced another lame smile and simply replied, “Of course, of course. Someone as weak as you needs as much energy as they can muster.” As soon as the words flowed from her mouth, Ino felt something else well up inside of her. This wasn’t anger, and it wasn’t pity… What it was, she couldn’t quite tell, but it was making her dizzy.

Sakura let out another “humph,” then said, “I have more than enough energy, thank you. Unlike you, I actually have potential.”

“The only thing you have is an enormous forehead! That brow is what you have more than enough of!” Part of Ino squealed with delight as her words escaped from her body, but as before, something began to make her feel uneasy and sick. It was as though her words were taking something from as they left. Her eyes were just barely able to maintain focus, but still, her perception was altered somehow. “It’s a shame, really. If your bust was as big as your mouth is, maybe then Sasuke would pay more attention to you!”

Ino’s face was becoming visibly flustered, turned bright pink. Sakura stopped her end of the argument, and wore a face of concern. Despite seeing her rival’s expression, Ino continued her verbal assault. She yelled, “You lack discipline and curves! It’s a wonder they let you pass through the academy. No brains, no beauty, and no chance!” Eventually the world became a blur to Ino, and she was forced to stop her tantrum and try to regain her composure.

She rubbed her eyelids hard with the palms of her hands until her vision returned. When she opened her eyes, however, what she saw made her second guess whether she was seeing clear or not. Sakura now seemed taller, but proportionally. That was impossible, Ino thought to herself, unless it’s some form of transformation or illusion technique.

“I’ll admit that you’re faster when it comes to performing techniques, but honestly, that’s no big accomplishment.” Ino crossed her arms over her chest and felt her clothing shift awkwardly. Her clothing seemed loose, which gave her a bit of a shock, but she played it off as nothing extreme. “A transformation spell? Or is it illusionary?” Sakura simply stared at her, unsure what she meant. “Either way, you’re a petty ninja, and this will be nothing for me to dispel.”

“Ino, I…” Sakura began, trying to find the words to respond. “I didn’t do anything…”

“Nonsense,” replied Ino, bringing her hands together in a quick clapping motion, and then forming the seal of ‘kai,’ or ‘release.’ “Dispel!” she hollered, but it was to no avail. She tried again, yelling, “Release! Grand release! Dispel!” Yet, nothing would work to reverse whatever change had occurred.

Sakura’s mind wandered aimlessly as she watched her rival struggle to form seals. She knew that she hadn’t done anything, but Ino wouldn’t be persuaded. Ino had simply began shrinking down. She must have lost a good two or three inches now, and it seemed to have stopped.

Ino stopped forming seals, and stopped calling out incantations. “It’s a decent technique, which isn’t like you at all, Sakura! I’ll call it a fluke, but it’s not something I’m going to be worried about. With your luck it’ll never happen again, you pathetic excuse for a ninja!” Suddenly, that odd feeling welled up again, and Ino felt the world twist out of proportion. Right before her eyes, Sakura seemed to grow a full inch or more.

As Sakura watched this, she put two and two together. She understood how this process was taking place, though she still had no idea how. It seemed that whenever Ino began to speak negatively about Sakura she would lose a small amount of height. Knowing this, how does Sakura react?

Sakura continued to watch with wide eyes as her rival threw violent insults at her in desperation. Ino was blinded by her belief that Sakura was the one who was making the changes, but the truth was that with each negative comment she hurled at Sakura, Ino was making herself shrink. Soon, Ino barely reached Sakura’s chin. At this point, she stopped and just stared up at her larger enemy.

“Weren’t you saying something, Ino-pig?” Sakura asked, becoming excited at the events that had transpired. “I believe you were calling me a low-rate ninja, and commenting on my lack of development. Especially around these.” She grabbed Ino’s head and thrust it into her chest. Ino tried to scream, but Sakura’s vibrant pink shirt absorbed the sound. The vibrations from Ino’s voice sent a wave of pleasure through Sakura’s body, and she sighed. As soon as Sakura let go of her, Ino staggered backward.

“What are you doing you horrible little wretch?” Ino hollered, catching her breath. “Shoving me into those tiny little bumps won’t do you any good! As soon as I find out how you’re pulling this technique off I swear I’m going to make you pay! I’ll make sure Sasuke never even looks at you! Why would he anyway, you’re so bland, and besides, he has me!” As soon as she uttered these insults her body began, once again, to slowly dwindle. Soon Ino found herself eye-level with those ‘tiny little bumps,’ just reaching Sakura’s breast line.

“You were saying?” asked Sakura coolly, staring down at her diminished rival with a sense of victoriously glee. Ino finally understood what was going on, and she quickly shut her mouth. Sakura moved in closer, taking pleasure in every inch she had over Ino. When Sakura was close enough, she grabbed Ino and lifted her body off the ground. She was delighted to find that the blonde was much lighter than before, and to Ino’s horror, much weaker. Try as she might, the shrinking woman could do nothing to loosen her grasp.

“Sakura! Dammit, put me down now! Let me go right now!” Ino kicked, and she squirmed, but to no avail. “Let me down, you little bitch! Let me down this instance or I’m going to make you sorry!”

Sakura let out a booming laugh as she felt Ino form dwindle in her arms. “Who’s the little one?” she asked, squeezing Ino so tightly that the little woman yelped in pain. After a minute or so of squeezing the woman in her arms, Sakura let Ino drop to the ground.

“That hurt you, you bitch…” Ino struggled to pick herself up, her chest aching horribly from having been squeezed so tightly. “Horrible, pathetic, useless bitch of a ninja…” Ino once more started to shrink, and Sakura couldn’t help but laugh.

“You’re doing it to yourself,” she explained while running her hand through her short, pink hair. “You could make it stop.” But Ino wasn’t in the right state of mind to comprehend this notion. All she knew was that Sakura had her in an illusionary technique, and that she had to get out. But this was useless, because it wasn’t true.

As Ino stood to her full height, she realized that she now only reached Sakura’s stomach. How will things progress from here?

---FLASHBACK----
Back at the Village Hidden in the Beast, the sun rose shining its light over the waking village. As the sunlight hit the window of a certain apartment, inside the newly blonde chunin, Naruto, quickly sat up and let out a loud yell.
“Yeah, good morning Yajuugakure! Believe it!” he yelled happily sitting on top of his bed.
“Naruto will you please keep it down!” an angry voice yelled from the other side of the wall next to Naruto’s bed.
“Hehe…Sorry Tenten. I guess I’m just a little excited.” Naruto responded to the voice.
Finished yelling, Naruto began to prepare for his day. He got out of his bed and walked across the room to a wooden dresser with a ninja doll placed on top.
As Naruto pulled open one of the drawers and lifted out a plain black shirt and black pants.
Outside the room, Tenten opened the door to her room and walked out fully dressed and was walking over to the stove to begin making breakfast. As she opened the fridge and pulled out a carton of eggs, Naruto opened his door and walked out fully dressed.
“Hey Tenten…What’s for breakfast?” he asked the kunoichi as she laid down a frying pan on the stove and turned it on.
“Nothing if you don’t help out. Now I need you to go and pick up some groceries.” Tenten said as she handed Naruto a list.
Without fighting, Naruto put on his shoes and left the apartment with the list in his hand.
“That was easy. I didn’t have to yell that time.” Tenten said as she began to crack open eggs and placed the yoke on the sizzling frying pan.
As Naruto left the apartment he walked down a flight of stairs that led to the ground.
As he made it the bottom of the stairs he began to walk toward one of the main streets and the market.
As he reached the street, he found it slightly crowded with people. With the amount of people walking down the road, Naruto had to push his way into the street and to get to his destination.
Once Naruto finally joined the flow of traffic he soon found himself stopping at a store by the side of the road.
As Naruto pushed his way to the store, he accidentally bumped into a tall man. The man had short black hair with a ninja headband and dark blue jumpsuit and a dark green vest.
Both Naruto and the man soon fell to the ground. As the two got up, the man showed a scowl on his face as he grabbed the collar of Naruto’s shirt.
“Hey brat! You better apologize!” the man yelled angry at Naruto.
“I would if you let go of me!” Naruto yelled back.
Outraged by Naruto’s response, the man threw Naruto backwards. The throw was weak as Naruto was able to land on his feet.
“You know what! You have a real attitude problem. I’m a chunin and your superior.” The man told Naruto.
“Hehe. Not quite. I’m a chunin too.” Naruto said chuckling.
“I guess the Ninja Council will make anyone a chunin.” The man said laughing.
As Naruto and the man argued, the scene they were causing has started to attract the attention of all the people walking pass the store.
“Naruto, you better cool it.” A voice said behind Naruto.
As Naruto looked behind him, he saw that it was Ookami that spoke.
“Ookami-sensei. I’m busy. This jerk thinks he’s…” Naruto began but was stopped by Ookami using his palm to cover Naruto’s mouth.
“Naruto, a chunin shouldn’t let a simple insult upset him.” Ookami began. Ookami then looked up at the man that Naruto was yelling at. The man still wore a scowl on his face as he stared at Naruto and Ookami.
“And you shouldn’t care about an insult from a fool.” Ookami added as he stared at the man.
“A fool, am I! Why don’t we just see whose the better ninja Ookami! You don’t scare me!” the man yelled as he and Ookami stood in a stare lock.
“You wouldn’t last five minutes against Naruto, let alone against me.” Ookami said calmly.
“Why you.” The man mumbled. Pushed to his limits, the man pulled a kunai from one of his vest pocket, and charged toward Ookami.
“That’s enough.” Another voice said. The man was then stopped in his track by an unseen force and was thrown back tremendously. The man crashed into a wall of another building and was covered in wreckage caused by the crash.
“Hello Raion.” Ookami said as he stared at the damage.
The tall, red-haired ninja, Raion appeared by Ookami’s left hand side.
Shocked at the sudden appearance, Naruto fell on his butt as he stared at Raion.
He wasn’t wearing his usual outfit. He wore a buttoned up blue shirt and black pants. He also held a lit cigar in his mouth.
“Ookami do you have a minute later?” Raion asked as he stood next to Ookami.
Naruto soon stood back up as he stood behind Raion and Ookami.
Ookami soon nodded and Raion left disappearing as fast as he appeared.
“Naruto have a good festival.” Ookami told Naruto as he began to leave.
“Huh, wait! What festival?” Naruto asked, stopping Ookami in his track.
‘That’s right. It’s not a surprise he doesn’t know.’ Ookami thought.
He then turned around to face Naruto and explained that there was a festival later tonight celebrating the appearance of the Howling Comet.
“Huh. Howling Comet?” Naruto asked confused.
“It’s a comet that appears once every ten years. It first appeared in the night sky on the very night Yajuugakure was fully created.” Ookami explained.
“Really, that’s so cool.” Naruto said excited.
“Well see you later.” Ookami said as he left.
“A festival tonight. I can’t wait!” Naruto said as he finally got the groceries and was heading back to the apartment. back at Naruto and Tenten’s apartment, the two chunin opened the door to their apartment and walked out. The sun has already gone down and the moon was fully covered by the Earth’s shadow, the only lights in the sky were the multiple stars in the sky.
As Tenten and Naruto left for the festival, they were wearing their usual outfits.
“The stars are out, it’s a new moon, and no sign of a cloud. Tonight is a perfect night for a festival and for comet gazing.” Tenten said as she looked at the night sky.
“Yeah, good thing I found out from Ookami, or we would have missed it.” Naruto said smiling.
“Naruto, I knew about the comet days ago.” Tenten told him.
“Huh…Wait how? I just found out.” Naruto asked shocked.
“I once overheard these two girls talking about it. You were with me.” Tenten told him with her hands on her hips.
“Oh. I see.” Naruto said sadly.
“Oh, but you know…I’m glad you reminded me today.” Tenten told him.
“Yeah, you would have forgotten. Hehehe.” Naruto said happily.
“Oh yeah! If I’m so forgetful then why don’t I forget about you and me going to this festival together!” Tenten angered by Naruto’s remark.
“Huh, we were going together? As a date?” Naruto said shocked.
“Huh. Maybe.” Tenten said smiling as she began to walk to the festival laughing under her breath.
“Hey wait! Are we or not!” Naruto called after her.
As the festival began, the main street and a few smaller streets were decorated and carts of different foods and games aligned the streets.
Amazed at all the fun, Naruto and Tenten enjoyed the festival and all the different games it had.
Soon three hours passed and it was almost midnight and almost time for the comet to appear.
As the comet arrival drew closer, ninjas ran across the building roof tops announcing the comet’s arrival.
As the ninjas disappeared, the villagers below all cheered and gathered with their families to watch the comet.
“Alright. Come on Naruto let’s go and get a good spot.” Tenten said happily as she pulled on Naruto’s jacket.
“Yeah. This is going to be great!” Naruto said as he joined Tenten in searching for a good spot.
Their search led them to the center of the village. Naruto and Tenten found a perfect spot on a roof there, as they laid down a red blanket with a yellow spiral on the roof to sit on.
“I wonder when the Howling Comet will appear.” Tenten asked as she stared at the star filled sky.
“That will be in ten minutes.” A voice said behind them.
Naruto and Tenten looked behind them to see Ookami standing there, Ookami’s face was pointing toward the sky but his eyes were staring at the two chunins.
“Hey Ookami-sensei. In ten minutes.” Tenten said wanting to confirm the information.
“Yup. The Howling Comet appears in the sky at twelve fourteen a.m every five years on this day. The day the Village Hidden in the Beast was created.” Ookami told them.
“That’s so cool. How many years ago was that?” Naruto asked excitedly.
“Naruto, I can’t believe you don’t know that.” Tenten said upset by Naruto’s question.
“Sorry, but I don’t remember. Do you Tenten?” Naruto asked her instead.
“Huh, of well…” Tenten said nervously as she redirected her face to the sky again. ‘I don’t know either but I can’t let Naruto find out. I’ll look like an idiot.’ Tenten said in her head.
“That was exactly thirty years ago.” Ookami told Naruto.
Naruto nodded his head at the answer while Tenten let out a breath of relief that she was off the hook, but she soon had a question pop up in her head and quickly asked Ookami.
“Thirty years. That seems a little young compared to the other villages.” Tenten said to Ookami.
“Yes it is, but the shinobi are just as powerful as any other non-main village.” Ookami said as he fully looked at Tenten.
“There it is!” a voice yelled gladly from the distance.
Soon Tenten, Naruto, and Ookami all looked up at the sky. As they stared at the sky, their eyes and faces lit up with joy as they saw the Howling Comet soaring through the sky.
The comet’s center was an orange red that sparkled with yellow constantly. The center was surrounded by light blue fire that covered the rock completely. Following the rock was the tail that was twice the length of the comet itself. The tail shined with the same flames as the comet but waved brilliantly like a wolf’s tail as the wolf ran.
“That’s so cool.” Naruto said admiring the comet.
“You two enjoy. It won’t appear for five years.” Ookami said as he soon left the two chunins alone on the roof.
“Huh where did Ookami-sensei go?” Naruto asked as he noticed the absence of their sensei.
“Who really cares now?” Tenten said as she kept staring at the comet.
Naruto nodded as he began to turn around to look at the comet, but as he turned his head, his eyes caught sight of some other beauty.
Naruto eyes stopped at Tenten’s face. As Tenten continued to stare at the comet, the light from the comet illuminated her body.
“Have you ever seen anything as beautiful as this?” Tenten said as she stared at the passing comet. The light from the comet showed a smile on her face as she watched happily.
“No, not that I can remember.” Naruto said softly as he himself stared at Tenten’s face.
“Really.” Tenten said as she finally looked around at Naruto. As she looked at Naruto, she saw that he was staring at her. As they exchanged stares, her heart rate began to race as she realized that he meant her.
They stared in each others eyes for what seemed to be forever as they saw the reflection of not only themselves but also what appeared to be each other standing next to their reflection.
Before they even thought about it, they both leaned forward to each other and let their lips meet. As they kissed on the roof the comet continued to soar and shine brightly in front of them. Illuminating their kiss with colors of red, orange, and yellow.
---END FLASHBACK---

1242111112221.content:
"Well, about time to be turning in", said Tsunade as she headed to her room. Neither Naruto or Tenten had ever actually seen the room in which Tsunade slept, so it was quite a shock to see it for the first time. Maybe it was because of their diminutive size from being shrunken, (however they doubted it) but the room was gigantic, much wider and spacious than any of the rooms they had ever actually seen. The bed seemed big enough to accommodate four grown people quite comfortably.

That was not the only overly large thing in this already huge room though as a giant vanity, on top of a few drawers, adorned the wall directly opposite the massive bed.And not too far from that a massive wall-length, full-body mirror. However not even this was the most surprising thing in the Hokages room, there eyes were more drawn towards two giant doors connecting into one big door that would appear to slide to both sides, the same thought flashed through both minds, 'what could possibly be in there?'. 12521.title: At The Office

125211.content:
Tsunade ruffled through the horrible stack of official Konoha documents that sat on her desk, searching for her latest status report. Since Sasuke left the village, things had been worse than ever. The morale within the village was slipping, and she had to find some way to boost the public’s interest in world affairs. Being a hokage never seemed as though it was going to be so much hassle. Still, she was a gambling woman, and these were the hands fate dealt her.

“Ah, finally,” she muttered to herself as she yanked a slip of paper from the stack, causing the pile to spill over. The loose paper covered the desk, and Tsunade sighed. From outside her office, she could hear noises which didn’t seem normal. There was a loud, muffled crash, followed by frantic footsteps. She stood, clenching her fists tight and preparing herself for the worst. What she got instead was… Naruto.

The door burst open, and there stood Naruto Uzumaki, his finger pointed directly at Tsunade’s enormous bust. This of course, wasn’t something that he did consciously, but one has to wonder.

“It took me twenty minutes to get here, so listen up!” Naruto declared loudly, forcefully placing his fist against his chest. “Today’s the day that I go out and find Sasuke! You’re going to give me full permission to gather a team and scour the land of the mist!”

Tsunade stared at Naruto for a moment, then answered, “No.” Naruto staggered backward, then asked in a whiny voice, “But why not, granny Tsunade? It’s been weeks, no, months since we’ve made any progress with the Sasuke case! You’ve said it yourself, we need to get more done! So, please, please!” He raised his hands together in a praying motion, pleading with her.

“Absolutely not,” she said firmly. “When I said we need to get more done, I meant that we need to buckle down right here. We have far too much to do here in Konoha, and it’d be a waste of man-power to send a team off to the land of mist.” Just then, Shizune entered the room and took a look around.

“Oh, thank heavens,” Shizune sighed. “With all the ruckus around here, I thought we were under attack.”

Tsunade ran her fingers through her blonde hair, then shook her head. “No, no… Naruto just popped in to pay me a visit. You know, the whole, ‘give me what I want’ bit.” Shizune nodded in understanding. Tsunade motioned toward the door, saying, “Will you please show Naruto out of the facilities. I’ve got more than enough work to do.”

“Right,” Shizune responded, placing her hand upon Naruto’s shoulder. “Please come with me, Naruto. Tsunade-sama has a lot of things to deal with-”

Naruto shrugged his shoulder violently, knocking Shizune’s hand off of it. “No!” he yelled, just as firmly as Tsunade had been. “If you’re not going to let me look for Sasuke, I want another mission. I want an S-Rank mission.”

Tsunade let out a deep sigh. “But you didn’t complete the last mission you were sent on successfully, remember? You were asked to go to the Far Lands and pick up the medicinal herbs, yet you happened to ‘lose’ them on the way back.” As she said this, something donned onto Naruto.

“Oh! The herbs, that’s right!” He pulled the mission bag from his back and retrieved from it a small box. The box looked as though it had been tossed about for some time, and there was even a slight tear in the side. Naruto rushed toward Tsunade and thrust the package forward a little too forcefully. Small pieces of the herbs fell all over desk from the tear in the side, but he managed to keep his grip on the box. “Here, so now the mission is successful and I can get to work on the next one, right?”

Now that she had the herbs in her possession, Tsunade no longer had to worry about filling out a ‘mission failure’ report. She sighed and grabbed the box from Naruto, then set it upon the desk. “I guess so, but I’m not prepared to hand out your next assignment. Come back in about three hours and I’ll have one ready for you.”

Naruto threw his hand in the air victoriously, saying, “That showed you to underestimate me!”

“Oh, and Naruto,” Tsunade began, “Wash your hands. Those herbs are poisonous.” Shizune then led Naruto out of the office while he worried frantically about whether he’d been poisoned and was going to die. As soon as the two were gone, Tsunade grabbed her tea cup and drained its contents in one quick gulp. Today had been such a hassle, and trying to keep track of Naruto’s next mission would be even worse.

An odd pressure was building up in her stomach, though she wasn’t sure what it was. Perhaps stress, she thought, and continued to file through the mound of paperwork. Little did she know that this pressure was much worse.

Dear Naruto,

If you are reading this, I am already dead. I am terribly sorry to leave you, my son, but I had to protect the village and its people. The only way I could defeat the nine-tailed beast was to seal him inside of you and for that, I am sorry. I would’ve loved to have seen you become a powerful ninja in your own right and your mother would’ve as well, had she not died in childbirth due to the stress she was going through with the Kyuubi no Kitsune attacking.
With this letter, I also leave you various scrolls on how to perform the Shunshin no Jutsu and how to develop it into the Hiraishin no Jutsu. As for my other technique, the Rasengan, I will have Jiraiya-Sensei, a white-haired man and a member of the Legendary Sannin, instruct you in its use. I must warn you: Jiraiya-Sensei is a very perverted guy. If you so much as become just as perverted as him, I will find a way to resurrect myself and beat you to a pulp. Anyway, have Jiraiya-Sensei teach you the Rasengan and be careful. When you are studying the scrolls, study each one to its end and practice what it teaches. After you’ve accomplished that, move onto the next scroll. I have also left you my own tri-pronged kunai that I used when performing the Hiraishin no Jutsu. Use them well, my son. If you end up with Kakashi as your instructor, make sure you work very hard for him. Despite his apparent lazy and somewhat perverted nature, he is a very strong ninja and is not to be taken lightly. He has copied over 1000 techniques since he gained a Sharingan eye from Uchiha Obito, who sacrificed his life to protect Kakashi, and will be able to counter almost any attack you throw at him. Listen to whatever he has to teach you, and take it to heart. I am sure you are wondering why you are named Uzumaki Naruto and not Kazama Naruto. I wanted to protect you as much as possible from any enemy villages, for I have made many enemies in my time as a ninja. Beware of any shinobi from Iwagakure for they are some of the most dangerous to cross paths with. Anyway, I gave you your mother’s lesser known maiden name of Uzumaki in the hopes that you will not be targeted.
Naruto, your mother and I love you very much. We wish we could be there for you in person. Just know that we’ll be there for you always in spirit. I know you will become a powerful ninja, and perhaps become Hokage one day. I have a picture of your mother and I included with this letter and the scrolls.

I wish you only the best, my son. I love you very much.

Sincerely,
Your father Kazama Arashi
Yondaime Hokage

Suddenly, Kin was struck with insperation on how she could find Naruto!

Echolocation!

Echolocation, also called Biosonar, is the biological sonar used by several mammals such as bats (not all of them), dolphins and whales. Echolocation works like active sonar, using sounds made by an animal. Ranging is done by measuring the time delay between the sound emission and any echoes that return from the environment. Unlike some sonar that relies on an extremely narrow beam to localize a target, echolocation relies on multiple receivers. Human echolocation was the ability of humans to sense objects in their environment by hearing echos off those objects. This ability is used by some blind people to navigate within their environment. It is similar in principle to active sonar and to the animal echolocation employed by some animals, including bats and dolphins.By interpreting the sound waves reflected by nearby objects, a person trained to navigate by echolocation can identify the location and sometimes size of nearby objects, and use this information to steer around obstacles and travel from place to place.

Kin quickly pulled out her bells and tied them to a Kunai knife, She hpoed this worked! Kin stuck the point of the kunai into the ground, placed her ear to the handle, closed her eyes to focious her senses on hearing and vibration, and tinkled her bells together. Immedatly, a wave of sensori input flooded into Kin's head from all over Leaf. She had just invented the Echolocation Jutsu! Kin would pat herself on the back after finding her intended target, she focioused on a mental image of Naruto.

Send word you're reached snow and spring once you're there." Hinata nods. "Good, Naruto I hope you behave... The pair of you, I don't normally send two young genin on their own. Even though she would rather let him sleep if possible, having known how much he'd gone through lately.

But it wasn't long before they reached the port and were aboard their ship to head to snow and spring. Once in their two bed cabin there was little to do. But while she was settling down, Naruto was busy going through his bag with haste. "W-what's wrong N-naruto-kun?" Naruto glanced up, before going back to his backpack.

"I picked up this scroll a couple day's ago. I thought I'd read it on the ship to keep me busy because I'll be board as hell till we get there... AH ha!" Naruto called as he pulled out the scroll. He set it on the bed and Hinata walked over curiously. "Let's see..." With a mutter, Naruto rolled out the scroll. "Hm, it's a bit faded... Can't make out the names of these jutsu..."

"You s-sure there j-jutsu Naruto-kun?" Naruto glanced over as Hinata walked over with a slightly red blush.

"You okay Hinata? You've been a bit red lately..." Hinata shook her head. "Right, well... Yeah, it's a jutsu scroll for sure, it's got handle seal lists and discription. Hm..." Hinata nods and both went through the symbols together. As they finished their was a blast of smoke and as it cleared, both glanced about and looked at each other. "Anything?" Hinata shook her head.

"I-it did say it would take some time to work." Naruto nods.

"I guess.... Let's see what other jutsu are in here..." But Naruto yawned, did that jutsu make him tired? Hinata yawned also, she felt tired too. "Maybe I'll get some sleep first, then take a look at the scroll another time. Naruto put his scroll away and nipped under the covers. Hinata glanced to Naruto before doing so, she felt something was off, but would think about it later. Laying under the covers, she closed her eyes and got some sleep.

5/12 UPDATE: This story has reached 41,000+ views and 748 chapters. This story is doing great, and I would like to thank anyone who has added so far. This story would be nothing without the readers. I really appreciate the support that you guys and girls have been giving, and I hope you continue to read and add.
